snippet: Some members, including the United Arab Emirates, have acknowledged that they need to diversify and wean themselves from an oil-rich diet.
abstract: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries says it will keep producing oil at current levels of over 31 million barrels daily, but some members admit their economies need to diversify; OPEC faces low-carbon ethos and global oil glut.

byline.original: By STANLEY REED and SARA HAMDAN
byline.contributor: Stanley Reed reported from Vienna, and Sara Hamdan from Ghantoot, Abu Dhabi. Elisabeth Malkin contributed reporting from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: Some members, including the United Arab Emirates, have acknowledged that they need to diversify and wean themselves from an oil-rich diet.

headline.main: Despite Climate Concerns, OPEC Plans to Keep Pumping Oil While It Can
headline.print_headline: Life After Oil in the Mideast

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
